poem:
**The Musk Effect**

Elon, a name like a comet,  
sprints across headlines, leaving trails  
of progeny and perplexity.  
The world, a stage of bewilderment,  
finds itself clutching its sides,  
laughing or groaning—it's hard to tell—  
as yet another bold enterprise  
finds a home in his celestial gaze.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "It’s Elon Musk’s ‘pronatalist’ bonanza – so many families, so little time | Marina Hyde If only Elon Musk could impregnate humans at the same rate he’s giving them the ick. Alas, polls show the efficiency tsar’s US approval rating dwindling towards levels he has enjoyed for quite some time among the UK public. And as a country that lived through the Boris Johnson era, I think we have to warn the Americans that if". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
